title: Ticket #165: Write FAQ entry regarding disabled Windows performance counters
description:
On rare occasion, a user reports Condor blowing up on Windows machines when executing inside ProcAPI; if you're lucky you get an error message that looks like: 

1/26 09:16:42 (fd:2) (pid:5732) ERROR: "Unexpected performance counter size for
    total CPU: 0 (expected: 8)" at line 2846 in file ..\src\condor_procapi\procapi.cpp

In condor-admin 18932, this happened in the ProcD so the only log message was in the SchedLog: 

1/20 15:29:14 (pid:2484) ERROR "unable to spawn the ProcD" at line 136 in file
    ..\src\condor_c++_util\proc_family_proxy.C

(#110 needs to happen to give us a fighting chance in debugging stuff like this!)

The culprit is disabled performance counters, and we should at the very least get a FAQ entry into our manual describing this problem. We should also change these EXCEPT messages to describe the likely cause.
remarks:
2009-Feb-02 14:16:23 by gquinn:
I've checked in a FAQ entry in the manual and better EXCEPT messages in ProcAPI.

2009-Feb-03 10:37:05 by burnett:
Would it be an idea to check the registry explicitly before the exception? Or do we know that this the only source of this type of error?
